definition: thought/idea/intention

to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])
variant of 念[nian4], to read aloud
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
eccentric notion/strange whim

sentences.english: Suddenly I had the idea of writing a message in a bottle.
sentences.chinese: “我突然冒出了写一封“瓶中信”的念头。

sentences.english: She was surprised by a wanton thought that rushed into her mind.
sentences.chinese: 一个放肆的念头在她心里闪过，叫她吃了一惊。

sentences.english: Dianetics class will tell you where these notions come from.
sentences.chinese: 戴尼提研习班会告诉你，这些念头来自哪里。

sentences.english: Bigamy lightened the horizon of his shadowy thoughts for a moment.
sentences.chinese: 一时间，在他的思想中模模糊糊闪出了重婚这个念头。

sentences.english: Imagine an idea as a tabletop.
sentences.chinese: 把一个念头想象成一张桌面。

sentences.english: If you can't help him, you'd better put him off.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不能帮忙，最好让人家打消念头。

sentences.english: Studies show, however, that the notion of anger catharsis is poppycock .
sentences.chinese: 然而，研究表明，怒气情绪宣泄的念头根本没有意义。

sentences.english: King Xerxes had a mad thought in his drunken state.
sentences.chinese: 满是醉意的亚哈随鲁王突然兴起一个疯狂的念头。

sentences.english: The promptings of the Holy Spirit will warn you that God is not pleased with the direction your thoughts and feelings are taking you.
sentences.chinese: 圣灵会警示你神不喜悦你念头和想法的方向。

sentences.english: Be honest with yourself, every time a thought intrudes start counting from the beginning again.
sentences.chinese: 不要欺骗自己，每次一个念头侵入时就从头开始计数。

sentences.english: You have to discard any thoughts of disbanding.
sentences.chinese: 你必须丢弃一切解散军队的念头。

sentences.english: They are imbrued with the follies of youth.
sentences.chinese: 他们满脑子都是年轻人的傻念头。

sentences.english: I've got something to tell you, I said.
sentences.chinese: 我点头，心里已经将这个念头扩到非说不可的地步了。

sentences.english: Balzac failures never faltered his drive to continue to write novels and novelettes .
sentences.chinese: 他屡屡失败，但从未放弃过继续写小说的念头。

sentences.english: With what thoughts was the unfortunate man contending?
sentences.chinese: 那倒霉的副主教在哪些念头里挣扎？

sentences.english: Why do you allow such silly ideas to come into that head of hers?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么让这种傻念头钻到她那个怪脑袋里？

definition: way of thinking/opinion/notion/to think of a way (to do sth)/CL:個|个[ge4]
to burgeon/to produce/to conceive/to be in the initial stage
to dispel (doubts, misgivings etc)/to give up on
plan/idea/decision/CL:個|个[ge4]/Beijing pr. [zhu2 yi5]
to have an urge/to be impetuous/impulse/urge
to make a firm resolution
desire/wish
brains/mind/CL:個|个[ge4]
to give birth/to grow (whiskers etc)/to generate/to produce
to have second thoughts about sth/to think better of
mind/thoughts/inclination/mood
to attempt vainly/a vain attempt/delusion
brains/mind/skull/(fig.) gist (of a matter)/leader/boss
to consider past cause and future effect (idiom); to think over the past and future/to ponder over reasons and connection
to think of/to call to mind/to anticipate
to plan/to intend/to calculate/plan/intention/calculation/CL:個|个[ge4]
